sentences.en: ...the devolution of power to the regions.
A system of devolution exists but has not been implemented.
sentences.cn: 这是一项转换体系,但至今还未实施.

sentences.en: Devolution east week, the week even king has a concubine's son to open, word wood.
sentences.cn: 相传东周时, 周平王有庶子名开, 字林.

sentences.en: From that time on, generation and YiNan person devolution , struggle not an interest.
sentences.cn: 自此, 一代代暨南人薪火相传, 奋斗不息.

sentences.en: Inheritance refers to the devolution of property on the death of its owner to other persons.
sentences.cn: 继承是指财产所有人去世时将财产转移给其他人.

sentences.en: Only a fool could think there was any advantage for Scotland in devolution.
sentences.cn: 只有傻瓜才认为把权力下放给苏格兰会对它有好处.

sentences.en: The majority of people in the province are in favour of devolution.
sentences.cn: 该省大多数人赞成权力下放.

sentences.en: Third, we should streamline the administrative structure, and this is related to the devolution of powers.
sentences.cn: 第三个内容是精简机构, 这和权力下放有关.

sentences.en: We are talking about devolution for Scotland.
sentences.cn: 我们在讨论向苏格兰分权的问题。

words.tran_cn: 相传，转移；委付；依次；落下

trans.tran_cn: 移交，授权，转移，授权代理
trans.tran_en: Devolution is the transfer of some authority or power from a central organization or government to smaller organizations or government departments
